column4: Meaning (English)

column3: الاسم الأعظم، الذي يدل على الذات الإلهية المعبودة.
column4: The Greatest Name, which indicates the Divine Essence that is worshipped.

column3: الفريد في ذاته وصفاته، الواحد الأحد.
column4: The Unique in His Essence and Attributes, the One and Only.

column3: العليّ في ذاته وصفاته، المتعالي عن كل نقص.
column4: The Most High in His Essence and Attributes, transcendent above all imperfection.

column3: الواسع الكرم، الذي لا يحدّ كرمه حد.
column4: The Most Generous, whose generosity is boundless.
The Deity, the One who truly deserves to be worshipped.
The First, the Eternal, who has no beginning.
The Last, the Everlasting, who remains after all else has perished.
The Manifest, the One who is above all things.
The Hidden, the One who knows the secrets and what is most concealed.

column3: الخالق المبدع من غير مثال سابق.
column4: The Originator, the Creator who brings into being without any prior example.

column3: الذي لا يزال برّه وإحسانه على خلقه.
column4: The Source of All Goodness, whose kindness and benevolence are continuous upon His creation.

column3: الذي لا يخفى عليه شيء في الأرض ولا في السماء.
column4: The All-Seeing, from whom nothing in the earth or the heavens is hidden.

column3: الذي يقبل توبة عباده ويعفو عنهم.
column4: The Accepter of Repentance, the One who guides to repentance and accepts it.
The Compeller, the One whose might compels all things to submit.

column3: الحافظ لخلقه، الذي يحفظ السماوات والأرض.
column4: The Protector, the Guardian of His creation, who preserves the heavens and the earth.

column3: الكافي لعباده، الذي يحفظ أعمالهم ويجازيهم عليها.
column4: The Reckoner, the Sufficient One for His servants, who records their deeds and recompenses them accordingly.
The Preserver, the One who protects His servants from all evil.
The Benevolent, the Gentle One with His servants, who aids and has mercy upon them.

column3: الثابت الوجود، الذي لا شكّ في وجوده.
column4: The Truth, the One whose existence is certain and absolute.
The Manifest, the One whose Oneness is evident.
The Wise, the One whose decrees and actions are perfect in wisdom.

column3: الذي لا يعاجل بالعقوبة، بل يؤخرها ليتوب عباده.
column4: The Forbearing, the One who does not hasten to punish, but gives time for repentance.
The Praiseworthy, the One who is praised for all His actions.
The Ever-Living, the One who has life without end.
The Self-Subsisting, the One who sustains Himself and all creation.
The All-Aware, the One who knows all things.
The Creator, the One who brings all things into existence from nothing.
The Creator, the One who creates and perfects His creation.
The Compassionate, the One who shows mercy to His servants.
The Most Gracious, the One who possesses vast mercy.
The Most Merciful, whose mercy encompasses all things.
The Provider, the One who provides sustenance for all creation.

column3: الحافظ الذي لا يغفل عن شيء.
column4: The Watchful, the One who observes all things and never neglects anything.

column3: السلام الذي سلم من كل عيب ونقص.
column4: The Source of Peace, the One who is free from all imperfections.
The All-Hearing, the One who hears all things.
The Appreciative, the One who rewards greatly for even small deeds.
The Most Appreciative, the One who rewards those who are grateful.
The Witness, the One who witnesses all things.

column3: الذي يصمد إليه الخلق في حوائجهم.
column4: The Eternal, the One to whom all creation turns in their needs.
The All-Knowing, the One who knows all things.
The Almighty, the One who is invincible and cannot be overcome.
The Magnificent, the One who is truly Great and deserves veneration.
The Pardoner, the One who forgives sins.
The All-Knowing, the One who has knowledge of all things.
The Most High, the One who is exalted above all things.
The Oft-Forgiving, the One who forgives sins abundantly.
The Forgiving, the One who conceals sins.
The Self-Sufficient, the One who is free of all needs.
The Opener, the One who opens the doors of goodness for His servants.
The All-Powerful, the One who is capable of all things.
The Subduer, the One who has dominion over all things.
The Most Holy, the One who is pure and free from all imperfections.
The All-Powerful, the One who has power over all things.
The Near, the One who is close to His servants.
The Strong, the One who is perfect in strength and cannot be overcome.
The Subduer, the One who overpowers all things with His might.
The Great, the One who is magnificent and exalted.
The Generous, the One who is noble and bountiful.
The Subtle, the One who is kind and gentle with His servants.
The Giver of Faith, the One who grants security and removes fear from His servants.
The Most Exalted, the One who is transcendent above all imperfections.
The Majestic, the One who is supremely exalted.
The Firm, the One who is strong and steadfast.
The Responsive, the One who answers the prayers of those who call upon Him.
The Glorious, the One who possesses glory and majesty.
The Encompassing, the One whose knowledge encompasses all things.
The Fashioner, the One who forms and perfects His creation.
The Powerful, the One who is capable of all things.
The Sustainer, the One who provides sustenance for His creation.
The King, the Sovereign, the Possessor of all dominion.
The Sovereign, the One to whom all sovereignty belongs.
The Protecting Friend, the Ally and Helper.
The Guardian, the Overseer of all things.
The Helper, the One who aids and supports His servants.
The One, the Unique, the Only One.
The Inheritor, the One who inherits all things.
The All-Encompassing, the One whose forgiveness is vast.
The Loving, the One who loves His servants and is loved by them.
The Trustee, the One who is entrusted with all affairs.
The Protecting Friend, the Guardian of the believers.
The Bestower, the One who bestows all gifts and blessings.
The Beautiful, the One who possesses absolute beauty.
The Generous, the One who is bountiful and giving.
The Judge, the Ruler, the Just One.
The Ever-Living, the One who possesses eternal life.
The Lord, the Master, the Sustainer.
The Companion, the One who is kind and gentle with His servants.
The Most Glorified, the One who is free from all imperfections.
The Master, the One who is obeyed.
The Healer, the One who cures the sick.
The Pure, the Good, the One who purifies.
The Withholder, the One who takes away life.
The Expander, the One who extends provision to His servants.
The Expediter, the One who brings forward whomever He wills.
The Delayer, the One who postpones whomever He wills.
The Doer of Good, the One who shows kindness to His creation.
The Giver, the One who gives without expecting anything in return.
The Bestower of Blessings, the One who blesses His servants with favors.
The One, the Unique, the Single.
